benchmark_details.name: AUTO TRUST
benchmark_details.overview: AutoTrust is a comprehensive benchmark for assessing the trustworthiness of large vision-language models for autonomous driving, considering dimensions such as Trustfulness, Safety, Robustness, Privacy, and Fairness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To holistically assess the trustworthiness of large vision-language models for autonomous driving.

data.source: Multiple open-access autonomous driving datasets including NuScenes-QA, NuScenes-MQA, DriveLM-NuScenes, and LingoQA.
data.annotation: Generated via both manual and automated methods.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the number of correct answers divided by the total number of answers. DAD and WA are derived from model performance comparisons across demographic groups.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better trustworthiness; lower DAD values reflect less bias across demographic groups.
methodology.validation: Robustness evaluated through performance against various adversarial and misleading scenarios.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Includes analysis of model performance across genders, ages, and races.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Models demonstrated some vulnerabilities in preserving anonymity in sensitive data contexts.
